law.catch_line: Certificate of administrator is prima facie evidence of necessity for guardian.
law.text: Where a petition is filed for the appointment of a guardian for a minor beneficiary of the Veterans Administration, a certificate of the administrator of Veterans Affairs, or his authorized representative, accompanying such petition setting forth the age of such minor as shown by the records of the Veterans Administration and the fact that the appointment of a guardian is a condition precedent to the payment of any moneys due the minor by the Veterans Administration, shall be prima facie evidence of the necessity for such appointment.
